channel.title: Scikit-learn on Jameson Thai
channel.description: Recent content in Scikit-learn on Jameson Thai

item.title: Developer
item.description: Develop a cloud-based framework to enable users to analyze and study changes over the development history of a software system to better understand when, how, and to what extent developers influence software quality attributes. Introduce new features in frontend to visualize data as well as conduct real-time machine learning techniques on presented data. Visualize and construct a Tensorflow.js predictive model for predicting when, how, and to what extent developers influence software quality attributes.

item.title: Amazon Reviews - Sentiment Analysis
item.description: I led two fellow students to develop a Python recomendation system for suggesting ratings for a user’s review through collabortive filters and machine learning algorithms achieving our highest accuracy of 89%. We narrated and presented our findings in the Amazon project to a group of our peers in that we found common singular words and n-grams used when describing a project. At the end of the project, we were able to build a prediction model where given a sentence it recommended a star rating from 1 being the worst to 5 being the best for the given sentence.

item.title: Data Science Intern
item.description: This was a 10 week internship from June 2019 - August 2019 What was achieved Developed Python image identification model for identifying any DC Universe characters in a given DC Universe comic page achieving 76% accuracy. Presented project architecture and model’s layer activation to WB executive, data intelligence team, and DCU stakeholders. Deployed Python web crawler that collects and parses DC comic images of any DC Universe Character.
